structural_elements: Triggered/Autonomous/Modular/Emergent levels; I-C-∫ formula
fidelity_notes: TAME's four levels → LPN's piece complexity levels. Classification framework preserved; subject matter transformed from minds to puzzle pieces.

structural_elements: I-C-∫ (Integration × Coordination × Integration over time)
fidelity_notes: Anster's mathematical integration → systematic edge encoding. The integration principle becomes physical interlocking.

structural_elements: Behavioral 'words' compose 'sentences'; prime-number cycles (2 3 5 7 11)
fidelity_notes: Brent's creature vocabulary → puzzle vocabulary. The principle of building complex from simple units preserved.

structural_elements: Creatures exhibit 2/3/5/7/11 behavioral cycles
fidelity_notes: Prime organization → categorical organization. Nine may relate to 3×3 prime structure. Dens amplified the systematicity.

structural_elements: 61% accuracy folk rules; Brent added 'behavioral verbs'
fidelity_notes: Folk rules → rival notation system. CQS represents the less systematic but functional approach.

structural_elements: Creature activity by season
fidelity_notes: Seasonal organization → optimal solving times. Dens may have encoded temporal patterns into puzzle work.

structural_elements: Tension fields; positive/negative edges; constellation boundaries
fidelity_notes: Tross's positive/negative boundaries → tabs/grooves as complementary tensions. High fidelity transformation.

structural_elements: KNN/KFN graph relationships
fidelity_notes: Neighbor relationships → which pieces can connect. Graph structure becomes puzzle assembly logic.

structural_elements: Bodies 'read' from library of possible forms
fidelity_notes: Pol's 'reading forms' → Little Porn's 'piece for a piece' completion transformation. Bodies reading forms → puzzles reading their solved state.

structural_elements: Space of possible forms that can be accessed
fidelity_notes: Abstract morphospace → concrete solution space. The Dens literalized the metaphor.

structural_elements: Balance between maintaining patterns and learning new ones
fidelity_notes: Keth's cognitive tradeoff → tension between solved sections and unsolved regions. Same dynamic different domain.

structural_elements: Sensitivity to novelty vs. pattern matching
fidelity_notes: Vigilance → how strictly pieces must match expectations. Threshold concept preserved in puzzle assembly.

structural_elements: Cognitive states organized in attractor basins
fidelity_notes: Each puzzle has a 'completion basin' that pulls solver toward solution. Keth's cognitive topology → mechanical assembly topology.

structural_elements: Six domains of system breakdown
fidelity_notes: Vorn's failure modes → ways pieces can fail to connect. Systematic approach to non-fitting.

structural_elements: How potential forms become actual
fidelity_notes: Potential → actual transformation. Placing a piece is ingression from solution-space to puzzle-space.

structural_elements: Same substrate computes differently for different observers
fidelity_notes: Creel's observer-dependent computation → puzzle interpretation varies by solver. Same physical pieces different experienced puzzles.

structural_elements: Following resonance signals to destinations
fidelity_notes: Voss's destination-finding → how solvers find correct pieces. The 'click' of correct placement as resonance signal.

structural_elements: Ghosts fade by exponential curves unless reactivated
fidelity_notes: Moll's memory decay → how puzzle progress fades if abandoned. Reactivation through resumed solving.

structural_elements: No East on W1 maps; three directions only
fidelity_notes: W1 directional limitation → maximum three connections per internal piece. Structural constraint encoded in puzzle physics.

structural_elements: Maps valid only at moment of completion
w2_manifestation: Puzzle states valid only at solving moment
fidelity_notes: Non-accumulation → puzzle solution is momentary achievement. Can be undone; must be remade.
